titleStmt.title: Daniel W. Lindsey, Special Orders, No. 67
CWG11948

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 37th - 76th Regiments Enrolled Militia Primary Source Documents (1861-1866)
msIdentifier.idno: Box 80, Folder 864- GRAYSON COUNTY Cpt. David Johnson's Co. Co. A, 45th Rgt. Ky. Militia

body.p:
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL.
KENTUCKY.
Head-Quarters Kentucky Volunteers,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE.
Frankfort, October 4 1864
SPECIAL ORDERS,
NO. 67

Col P. G. Reese of the 45 Ky Militia is hereby ordered to take such portion of his command as he may deem necessary, and take possession of all properly captured by one Capt Johnson and any other Home or State Guard organization in Grayson County. He will hold such Officers until the property is given up or a satisfactory account of the disposition of some. He will make an inventory of said property designating such as was captured from Guerillas, and such as belonged to Citizens and recaptured, and send said inventory to Brigr Genl S. G. Suddarth Quarter Master Genl Ky who will give him full instructions in regard to the disposition of said property. He will compel Capt Johnson to show his authority for acting or forming an Independent Company

By command of the Governor:
(sgt) D W. Lindsey
Inspr & Adjurant General of Kentucky.

A true Copy
Attest
D. W. Lindsey
Inspr & Adjt Genl of Ky
